Detailed Description

Class that represent a hashtable for OldItems.

Definition at line 190 of file OldMapHashTable.h.

int32  hmax,
int32  vmin,
int32  vmax,
uint32  nbrVerticalCells,
uint32  nbrHorizontalCells,
OldGenericMap *  theMap
) 
 

Constructor.

Calculates the parameters of the hashingfunction by using the parameters.

Parameters:
hmin Minimum horizontal coordinate of the boundingbox
hmax Maximum horizontal coordinate of the boundingbox
vmin Minimum vertical coordinate of the boundingbox
vmax Maximum vertical coordinate of the boundingbox
nbrVerticalCells The preferred number of vertical cells.
nbrHorizontalCells The preferred number of horizontal cells.
theMap Pointer to the map where the items are located.

virtual OldMapHashTable::~OldMapHashTable (   )  [virtual]
 

Destructor.

Frees memory allocated by the cells.

Vector* OldMapHashTable::getAllWithinRadius_MC2Scale (  int32  hpos,
int32  vpos,
int32  radius,
bool &  shouldKill
) 
 

Finds all elements inside the circle defined by (hpos, vpos) and radius.

Parameters:
hpos The horizontal part of the coordinate for the center of the circle.
vpos The vertical part of the coordinate for the center of the circle.
radius The maximum distance in MC2 scale from (hpos, vpos) to the items returned by this method.
shouldKill Is set to true if the Vector* returned by this methos should be deleted by the caller. Set to false if the caller { must not} delete the Vector.
Returns:
Pointer to a Vector containing IDs of the items within a distance < radius from (hpos, vpos).

Vector* OldMapHashTable::getAllWithinRadius_meter (  int32  hpos,
int32  vpos,
int32  radius,
bool &  shouldKill
) 
 

Finds all elements inside the circle defined by (hpos, vpos) and radius.

Parameters:
hpos The horizontal part of the coordinate for the center of the circle.
vpos The vertical part of the coordinate for the center of the circle.
radius The maximum distance in meters from (hpos, vpos) to the items returned by this method.
shouldKill Is set to true if the Vector* returned by this methos should be deleted by the caller. Set to false if the caller { must not} delete the Vector.
Returns:
Pointer to a Vector containing IDs of the items within a distance < radius from (hpos, vpos).

uint32 OldMapHashTable::getClosest (  int32  hpos,
int32  vpos,
uint64 &  closestDist
) 
 

Finds an element closest to (hpos, vpos).

Parameters:
hpos Horizontal position to match
vpos Vertical position to match
closestDist Distance to the found gfxitem.
Returns:
The closest element to (hpos, vpos). If no element is found NULL is returned, this is however extremely rare.

Some coordinate-systems are scaled horizontally.

Returns:
The horizontalFactor cosine for the current latitude.

bool OldMapHashTable::isItemTypeAllowed (  ItemTypes::itemType  t  ) 
 

Checks if the itemtype is inlined.

Parameters:
t The itemtype
Returns:
True if the itemtype was allowed, false otherwise.

OldItem* OldMapHashTable::itemLookup (  uint32  itemID  )  [inline, private]
 

Used to get a item with a specified id.

The returned item has a valid type, otherwise NULL is returned. NB! If no item types has been set allowed then all are supposed to be valid! This method should not be used, since it is not thread safe. This method is inlined.

Parameters:
itemID ID of the wanted item.
Returns:
Pointer to the item with itemID { if} it is a valid id { and} it has allowed type -- false otherwise.

void OldMapHashTable::setAllowedItemTypes (  const set< ItemTypes::itemType > &  types,
const UserRightsMapInfo *  rights = NULL
) 
 

Clears allowed item types and adds the types in the set.

Parameters:
types The allowed item types for this run.

int OldMapHashTable::trimToSize (   ) 
 

Trims the storage of the elements to the actual size.

Returns:
The number of elements removed.
